He has gained the respect of the students and they enjoy going to his class. Charlie is passionate about teaching students the importance of exercising and encourages them to keep moving even when not in school. He jumps in and participates in the activities he has the students do in class. Charlie deserves the "Every Student, Every Day" award because that is what is important to him!" Congratulations Charlie!! #BtonMS

Good Day! We have improved Internet connectivity throughout Coffey County in the past two weeks. Expanded Hot Spots are around the schools, with BHS and BES having tables and benches for kids. - Communication between students, families, and staff will be important during Continuous Learning.
- Staff will update grade books on a weekly basis and talk to administration, students, and family members about concerns.

It is important to remember that we all need to work together during Continuous Learning. Take Care! God Bless!! Continue To SHINE!!!

244Alert from BES Principal Darla Long:
At the request of the Transportation Department, we are sending a friendly reminder about morning busing/drop-off’s. The morning drop-off procedure at BES is located at the half circle drive on the south side of the building it is a Bus Drop Off Zone ONLY. We ask that all vehicles refrain from using this as a parking area and/or a drop-off zone from 7:30 to 8:30 a.m. for any reason.

You are welcome to park in any of the designated parking areas or along Niagara Street, as well as, utilizing the drop-off zone on the east side of the building (Hug-n-Go). Violators may be reported to law enforcement and can be ticketed. Thank you for your cooperation with this matter!
